The passage of House Bill 170: which is projected to raise nearly $670 million in transportation funding next year.
The introduction of new fees for drivers: the end of a popular tax credit for electric cars, and a $5 per-night fee on hotel/motel stays.
The statement made by House Transportati: emphasizing the goal of improving the transportation network and moving Georgia forward.
The opposition to the bill: including the criticism from Senator Mike Crane and the Twitter post by Debbie Dooley, co-founder of the Atlanta Tea Party Patriots, referring to the bill as a "midnight run" on taxpayers and a billion-dollar tax increase.
